intro: Espostoa melanostele subsp. melanostele, commonly known as the black-stemmed espostoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its dark, woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native environment. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
